messages.messageBody:
That is the one although it appears to be from paypal it isn't. expand your
header information, go to sam spade tools and you will see who it really is
from.

dirk

> I received a similar scam but it "was"from "paypay" regarding my credit

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] BEWARE; NEW EBAY SCAM
messages.msgSnippet: I received a similar scam but it was from paypay regarding my credit card.  It wanted my atm I used sam spade tools and found it utilized a road runner
messages.messageBody:
I received a similar scam but it "was"from "paypay" regarding my credit
card. It wanted my "atm"
I used sam spade tools and found it utilized a road runner account in new
york. I knew it was a scam but after the 10th attempt i got tired of it and
reported it.

messages.subject: BEWARE; NEW EBAY SCAM
messages.msgSnippet: There is a new scam involving Ebay.  When you bid on an item and it is not sold you may receive an e-mail that purports to be from the seller offering to sell
messages.messageBody:
There is a new scam involving Ebay. When you bid on an item and it is
not sold you may receive an e-mail that purports to be from the seller
offering to sell you the item very reasonably and requesting that you pay by
wire transfer to an overseas bank.

THIS IS A SCAM. THE E-MAIL IS NOT FROM THE SELLER. IF YOU SEND THE
MONEY YOU WILL GET NOTHING BUT A LESSON IN FRAUD.

Somehow an overseas con artist is obtaining the e-mails of bidders and them
attaching the pictures and descriptions used in the original auction.

Dale Garbutt
4109-347-8710







[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
